resources.string: There is no data, try to refresh.

Storage permissions are used:

 1.Import/export host information.
 2.Save crash log

 If you want to use these features properly, please allow that permission.
This will export current hosts to file:\nsdcard/bandwagon_host_backup.json
This will import hosts record in sdcard/bandwagon_host_backup.json.\n Attention: host will be replaced directly if they has the same VEID.
This will send an email containing the crash log to the developer. It is very helpful for debugging.
This will overwrite all data on the VPS.\nAre you sure?

A snapshot is a full copy of the VPS that can be created for backup purposes. 

 1. Snapshots can be used to restore the VPS to the exact same state as when the snapshot was taken (with all files and installed software in place).

 2. Snapshots are stored for 30 days. After 30 days snapshots are automatically removed, so it is best to download them and keep a local copy.

 3. Some snapshots can be set sticky. Sticky snapshots are never removed automatically. However, you can only have 2 sticky snapshots.

 4. You can create a new snapshot by clicking the floating action menu below. 
 Please note that your VPS will be rebooted during the process; however, total downtime will be just a few seconds regardless of the number or size of files on your VPS.

 5. You can import a snapshot from another VPS by clicking the floating action menu below. 
 This feature allows to "pull" an existing snapshot from another VPS and add it to the above list of available snapshots. The original snapshot will not be deleted.
Sticky snapshots are never removed automatically. However, you can only have 2 sticky snapshots.\n This action will toogle sticky.
Creating snapshot… We will send you an email once task is completed.
Attention: Both VEID and Token must be obtained from another instance beforehand with a snapshot/export call.
